This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"closeLeveragedPosition(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"If swap fails, use closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd() insteadHIGH-14 fix: whenNotPaused removed so users can always close positions and repay debt, even during emergency pause.","params":{"minCollateralOut":"Minimum collateral to receive (slippage protection)","userMaxSlippageBps":"User-specified slippage tolerance in bps (0 = use global default, must be <= maxSlippageBps)"},"returns":{"collateralReturned":"Amount of collateral returned to user"}},"closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256)":{"details":"Use this if closeLeveragedPosition() fails due to swap issues. User provides mUSD to repay debt, receives ALL collateral back. This completely eliminates swap failure risk.HIGH-14 fix: whenNotPaused removed so users can always close positions and repay debt, even during emergency pause.","params":{"musdAmount":"Amount of mUSD to provide for debt repayment"},"returns":{"collateralReturned":"Amount of collateral returned to user"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"emergencyClosePosition(address,uint256)":{"details":"Admin can forcibly close. If full repayment fails, collateral stays in the contract for the protocol to recover \u2014 NOT returned to user. Prevents orphaned bad debt (debt in BorrowModule with no backing).","params":{"emergencySlippageBps":"Allow wider slippage for emergency scenarios","user":"The user whose position to emergency-close"}},"emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Timelock delay (48h) is enforced by the OZ TimelockController, not here"},"getMusdNeededToClose(address)":{"params":{"user":"The user's address"},"returns":{"musdNeeded":"Amount of mUSD required to repay debt and close position"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"_admin":"Admin address for role grants","_borrowModule":"BorrowModule contract address","_collateralVault":"CollateralVault contract address","_musd":"mUSD token address","_priceOracle":"PriceOracle contract address","_swapRouter":"Uniswap V3 swap router address"}},"openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"collateralToken":"The collateral token (e.g., WETH)","initialAmount":"Initial collateral deposit","maxLoopsOverride":"Max loops for this position (0 = use default)","swapDeadline":"User-supplied swap deadline (must be > block.timestamp)","targetLeverageX10":"Target leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x, max based on LTV)","userMaxSlippageBps":"User-specified slippage tolerance in bps (0 = use global default, must be <= maxSlippageBps)"},"returns":{"loopsExecuted":"Number of loops completed","totalCollateral":"Total collateral after loops","totalDebt":"Total mUSD debt"}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setMaxLeverage(uint256)":{"params":{"_maxLeverageX10":"Max leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 15=1.5x, 20=2x, 25=2.5x, 30=3x)"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"title":"LeverageVaultUpgradeable","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"EmergencyRepayFailed(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when emergency close debt repayment fails"},"LeverageClosedWithDirectRepay(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Event for direct mUSD repayment close (no swap needed)"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"closeLeveragedPosition(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Close leveraged position - repay debt and withdraw collateral"},"closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256)":{"notice":"Close leveraged position by providing mUSD directly"},"defaultPoolFee()":{"notice":"Default Uniswap pool fee tier (3000 = 0.3%)"},"disableToken(address)":{"notice":"Disable a collateral token"},"emergencyClosePosition(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emergency close a position when normal close fails (e.g., bad debt)"},"emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Emergency withdrawal of stuck tokens \u2014 must be called through MintedTimelockController"},"enableToken(address,uint24)":{"notice":"Enable a collateral token for leverage"},"estimateLoops(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Estimate loops needed for target leverage"},"getEffectiveLeverage(address)":{"notice":"Calculate effective leverage for a position"},"getMusdNeededToClose(address)":{"notice":"Get the mUSD amount needed to close a position via closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd()"},"getPosition(address)":{"notice":"Get user's current position"},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initialize the upgradeable contract (replaces constructor)"},"leverageEnabled(address)":{"notice":"Whether a collateral token is enabled for leverage"},"maxLeverageX10()":{"notice":"Maximum allowed leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x max)"},"maxLoops()":{"notice":"Maximum number of leverage loops per transaction"},"maxSlippageBps()":{"notice":"Slippage tolerance in basis points (e.g., 100 = 1%)"},"minBorrowPerLoop()":{"notice":"Minimum borrow amount per loop (prevents dust loops)"},"openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Open a leveraged position with automatic looping"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause all leverage operations"},"positions(address)":{"notice":"User leverage 2.5x, 3x)"},"tokenPoolFees(address)":{"notice":"Per-token pool fee overrides"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpause leverage operations (requires admin for separation of duties)"}},"notice":"UUPS-upgradeable version of LeverageVault. Automatic multi-loop leverage with integrated Uniswap V3 swaps. Users can open leveraged positions in a single closeLeveragedPosition(uint256,uint256,u.details: If swap fails, use closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd() insteadHIGH-14 fix: whenNotPaused removed so users can always close positions and repay debt, even during emergency pause.

params.userMaxSlippageBps: User-specified slippage tolerance in bps (0 = use global default, must be <= maxSlippageBps)

returns.collateralReturned: Amount of collateral returned to user

closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256).details: Use this if closeLeveragedPosition() fails due to swap issues. User provides mUSD to repay debt, receives ALL collateral back. This completely eliminates swap failure risk.HIGH-14 fix: whenNotPaused removed so users can always close positions and repay debt, even during emergency pause.

params.musdAmount: Amount of mUSD to provide for debt repayment

returns.collateralReturned: Amount of collateral returned to user

emergencyClosePosition(address,uint256).details: Admin can forcibly close. If full repayment fails, collateral stays in the contract for the protocol to recover  NOT returned to user. Prevents orphaned bad debt (debt in BorrowModule with no backing).

params.emergencySlippageBps: Allow wider slippage for emergency scenarios
params.user: The user whose position to emergency-close

emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256,addres.details: Timelock delay (48h) is enforced by the OZ TimelockController, not here

returns.musdNeeded: Amount of mUSD required to repay debt and close position

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.maxLoopsOverride: Max loops for this position (0 = use default)
params.targetLeverageX10: Target leverage  10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x, max based on LTV)
params.userMaxSlippageBps: User-specified slippage tolerance in bps (0 = use global default, must be <= maxSlippageBps)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

closeLeveragedPosition(uint256,uint256,u.notice: Close leveraged position - repay debt and withdraw collateral

closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256).notice: Close leveraged position by providing mUSD directly

emergencyClosePosition(address,uint256).notice: Emergency close a position when normal close fails (e.g., bad debt)

emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256,addres.notice: Emergency withdrawal of stuck tokens  must be called through MintedTimelockController

enableToken(address,uint24).notice: Enable a collateral token for leverage

estimateLoops(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Estimate loops needed for target leverage

getEffectiveLeverage(address).notice: Calculate effective leverage for a position

getMusdNeededToClose(address).notice: Get the mUSD amount needed to close a position via closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd()

leverageEnabled(address).notice: Whether a collateral token is enabled for leverage

maxLoops().notice: Maximum number of leverage loops per transaction

minBorrowPerLoop().notice: Minimum borrow amount per loop (prevents dust loops)

openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,ui.notice: Open a leveraged position with automatic looping

setMaxLeverage(uint256).notice: Set maximum allowed leverage (toggle between presets: 1.5x, 2x, 2.5x, 3x)

unpause().notice: Unpause leverage operations (requires admin for separation of duties)
